Fields.DialogueText: Well, look at that, Nautilus. I knew that pearl would look amazing on you.
Golly, Captain. You think so?
Of course, I think it made a lovely necklace.
I suppose...
Is everything all right? You seem a little down.
The pearl is nice and everything, but it's not the same. I guess I just still miss Narwhal's pearl.

Fields.MenuText: That makes sense. I wasn't really trying to replace it. I just wanted to get you something nice.
I guess my plan failed, then. Here I was, trying to make you forget all about that.
Was Narwhal's pearl really that much nicer?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yes, I know, and it's a beautiful gift. Looking at it just sometimes reminds me of that loss.
You did something wonderful for me. I love it, but I also think feeling it around my neck is just a reminder of the pearl I lost.
It's not about how it looked. It's about what it meant. It was a gift from Narwhal, and that meant a lot.
I'm just being all melodramatic. I'll get over it and be right as rain soon enough. Don't you worry, Captain.
Okay, if you say so. Maybe I should've gotten you something else. Like another new camera for you to lose.
Hey, I don't lose them, I...
*ALARM*
I blame the Morganas!
Then let's take it out on them. Apparently they owe us a few cameras.
@BATTLE
Hiya, Captain! You're dropping by to help me prep for the All Belle Games?

Fields.MenuText: That's still a thing? Honestly, I totally forgot about that.
I just wanted to check in on my favorite Belle and see how she's doing.
Well, you're going to need all the help you can get if you're going to bring home the gold.

Fields.DialogueText: Golly, Captain, how could you forget about them?! I've only been raving about them for just about ever!
D'aww, Captain, you don't have to check on me. I'm just getting a little practice in.
You think I could manage to bring home the gold medal? Gee, I like that you have so much faith in me, Captain.
You know, hearing you call me "Captain" so easily is a little unsettling.
Really? I thought that's what you wanted.
It is, but I suppose I was getting a little used to Cap.
Well, too bad, Captain. I worked really hard to start calling you "Captain", and I'm not going to stop, Captain.
Okay, okay, I get it. Just get back to your games preparations.
Will do, Cap-tain.
You're enjoying that far too much.
You just made it a lot more fun.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Look at this, Nautilus. It looks like we've got a location for the All Belle Games.
Golly, already?! I thought I had more time!

Fields.MenuText: Looks like you don't. Oh, well.
Don't worry too much, Nautilus, you're going to do fine.
The sooner the better! Let's get to the games!

Fields.DialogueText: Macaroni, Captain! How can you be so nonchalant about all this?
How can you be so sure? What if "fine" isn't good enough!?
Can't you see I'm a little worried here, Captain!?
I still have so much I want to do before the games! So much practice, so much training!
Hey, we still have to make our way there. You have plenty of time.
Really? I... I guess you're right... Okay, I can breathe again. Thanks, Captain.
I don't think I've ever seen you so panicked before.
Well, it just snuck up on me. I don't like being snuck up on. Keep that in mind.
I'll remember that.
*ALARM*
Morganas. Just what I need. As soon as we pummel these fools, I've gotta get right on my training!
Then I suppose we'd better hurry.
@BATTLE
Oh, Captain, look at those mountains! Can we go mountain climbing?
We're a submarine, Nautilus.
Oh, I think I can see the lights of a city at the base of the mountain. We should go and visit them!
We're kind of in a hurry, aren't we?
Oh, a forest! Maybe we could go camping. I love s'mores.
Okay, I think that's enough time on the periscope.
Aw, phooey, I was having fun.

Fields.MenuText: Shouldn't you be training or something? We'll be at the games soon.
Well, you were distracting the crew.
I could tell, but there are better ways to spend your time.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! You're right! I've been getting too distracted by the sights!
Who was I distracting? You? That guy? I wasn't hearing any complaints.
How? Oh... Wait... I'm suppose to be training!
Okay, I've got to run. If anyone needs me, I'll be in the mess.
Doing what?
Weren't you listening? Running. I haven't tried my stamina, like, at all.
@BATTLE
You were distracting yourself. Isn't there something more important you should be doing?
Applesauce! I should be training for the games!
*ALARM*
Here comes some exercise for you!
*THUMP*
Ooooh, ouuuuch!
Nautilus, what happened!?
I... I don't like jump ropes anymore.

Fields.MenuText: Never trust a jump rope.
A jump rope? What were you doing with a jump rope on a submarine? Where'd you even get it?
I didn't realize there was a jump roping competition in the games.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, that's a lesson I learned today, Captain.
You can get a lot of interesting stuff at port. You'd be amazed what falls in the water there.
There isn't, that would be silly. I just heard that it was a good way to train.
Ugh, get this thing away from me. It's evil.
This is your jump rope? It looks ancient. It looks more dangerous than some of the weapons we have on board.
*ALARM*
Maybe we should try using it on the Morganas, then.
Are you good to fight?
I'm not made of glass, Captain. I'm ready to kick some Morgana hide!
@BATTLE
There were a lot more Belles there than I was expecting to show up.
Even Belles need a break every once in a while to have a little fun. You'd be surprised how competitive some of us can get.

Fields.MenuText: I'm guessing you're here for the fun?
And, are you one of those competitive sorts?
I guess you learn new things about Belles everyday.

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, pretty much. As long as we're all having a good time, I'm happy.
Not so much. I don't care about winning as much as I do about having a good time. Although, of course, what's more fun than winning, huh, Captain?
I'm guessing we'll both be learning a whole lot about Belles during these games. I can't wait to see what some of these girls can do.
All right, so let's look at our schedule here. What's up first?
Looks like we've got diving first.
Oooh, I'm still not too confident there.
What about the obstacle course? That seems more up to your speed.
Hmmm... I could handle an obstacle course. Sounds fun, actually.
Then the sprint, a potato sack race, and finally we finish with the javelin toss.
Javelin toss? That's interesting.
*ALARM*
I wish we had some javelins to toss at these guys.
We don't need javelins. We're surrounded by other Belles. We easily outnumber the Morganas. They picked the wrong place to show up.
You have a good point. This is going to be a massacre.
@BATTLE
Let's tackle that group over there!
Did you hear how impressed those other officers were, Captain? They couldn't stop complimenting my guns!

Fields.MenuText: As they should. You're an asset to the fleet, Nautilus.
I'd wager they'd say anything to spend more time with you, Nautilus.
I hope that's not a euphemism for something, Nautilus.

Fields.DialogueText: What is this, compliment day? We should make this a weekly event!
I'm not sure whether that's a compliment to me or an insult to my guns.
What do you mean? Oh! No, I was just showing off our artillery. You have such a dirty mind sometimes, Captain.
We have the largest guns of any American sub, and I like it when others remember that fact.
Just don't forget that size isn't everything.
Well, it's a good thing my babies got power too! And, don't forget their gallons of pizzazz!
*ALARM*
Ooh, perfect timing! Let's go show these puppies off!
Just be careful where you're aiming your torpedoes. We have a lot of friendlies in the water.
Golly gee, Captain. You're embarrassing me!
@BATTLE
I'd take it as the former.
But my guns are still great, right?
Heh, of course they are.
That... was... so embarrassing!
What happened?
I was talking to some of the foreign Belles and... I completely forgot everything I had learned.
All the French I'd been practicing, all the Russian, and Japanese I'd rehearsed for the games... Everything was just gone!

Fields.MenuText: You forgot entire languages? That's a whole new level of forgetful.
I'm sure it was just the nerves, or the stress, or something.
At least you remember English. I'm sure that's enough to communicate with a lot of the Belles.

Fields.DialogueText: I know! I was studying French so hard too! How did it all just fly out of my head like that?
Maybe... I hope you're right... The only thing I can remember to say in Russian is no. Nein.
That's not the point! I wanted to impress them! Instead, I've just made a fool out of myself...
Now I'll never get to read Vi... Vin... I can't even remember what "Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea" is in French!
The last thing you should be worrying about is languages. The games are about to start. Don't let this get inside your head.
You're right, Captain. Let's do a quick patrol or something. I need to clear my head.
@BATTLE
Wait, I think that's German.
Honeysuckle!
Coming right up. I know you won't forget how to fight.
I'm sorry you lost, Nautilus, but that was an intense first competition.
I know, right? I'm not even angry. Some of those Belles were able to dive twice as far as me. How do they even do that?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you should ask them to teach you.
I don't know. I'd say they're not human, but we already knew that.
I want to say it had something to do with buoyancy, but I can't really be sure.

Fields.DialogueText: That's not a bad idea. Now that the competition's over, there's no reason for them not to share their secrets with me.
Yeah, that excuse doesn't work as well when none of the competitors are human.
Well, I wasn't expecting an actual answer. You're smart, but you're no scientist or anything.
Losing the first competition isn't how I wanted to start the games, but there's nothing I can do about it now. What's next?
That would be the obstacle course. How confident are you about that one?
Hmmm... Pretty confident, but I won't be sure until I see the actual course.
Well, that makes sense. I think your chances are better for this one. I doubt diving ability will help anyone this time.
What will help is limbering up. Let's go stretch out my muscles with a good fight.
@BATTLE
Consider it done. Morganas make challenging obstacles, after all.
That was amazing, Nautilus!
Golly, Captain, thanks, but the obstacle course was underwater. You could hardly see me.

Fields.MenuText: I could see enough. You completely left them in your dust.
Maybe not, but I have a good imagination. In my head, you were amazing.
I just mean winning. I wasn't expecting you to win anything!

Fields.DialogueText: Hehe, I guess I did, didn't I?
Amazing, huh? I guess I might've been a little awesome.
I'd be ticked off if I wasn't still riding this high, Captain.
Everything's coming up aces, Captain! Looks like Lady Luck is on my side today.
*ALARM*
Sounds like you might've spoken too soon.
Oh, no, Captain. Not even Morganas can ruin this mood I'm in. Let's go get another victory!
@BATTLE
She's a fickle--
Good job, Nautilus. You weren't too shabby there.
Oh, phooey, I just got third. That's just the best loser.

Fields.MenuText: It could be worse. You could've gotten fourth. Or fifth. Oh, don't even get me started on sixth!
Don't be complaining. A medal is a medal, Nautilus.
Actually, I'm pretty sure that's second place.

Fields.DialogueText: I get it, Captain. You're right. I should keep my chin up.
I know, I know. I'm just a little bummed.
Oh, great, so I'm not even the best loser. I'm the second best loser.
I've just got to get my head out of this funk. Winning isn't everything.
Plus, you know, sprinting has never been my thing. Now, if it was a marathon, I could outrun any of the other Belles.
I didn't know you could get so competitive.
Oh, don't get me wrong, I'm still having the best time. And all the other Belles are amazing. I just want to be sure to show them how amazing I am too.
Well, I don't think you have to worry about that, Nautilus. You're definitely giving them a run for their money.
@BATTLE
You think so?
*ALARM*
That was so much fun!
Really? Even though you almost came in last place?
It was a potato sack race! You can't spend your day jumping around in a sack and not have fun.

Fields.MenuText: You have a point.
That doesn't sound even remotely fun to me.
You know what's even more fun? Winning.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey, I still got the sack if you want to give it a go!
Sounds like somebody has to learn how to have a good time.
If you're not having fun while you're winning, then you're actually losing.
So, it looks like we've just got the javelin toss left, Captain.
Followed by the award ceremony. You're getting two whole medals.
Golly, I guess I did pretty good, huh?
*ALARM*
Well, let's keep up that good streak! Though, I don't have any medals to award for Morgana fighting.
That's okay, two is more than enough for me. I've only got one neck, after all.
@BATTLE
Uh, no, I think I'll take a rain check, but thanks.
So, is this supposed to be the javelin toss competition? Where are the targets? I can't see anything in this fog.
It has gotten really foggy all of a sudden. It's not usually this bad around here, is it?
What are you thinking, Nautilus?
I'm worried that this fog isn't fog at all. It looks too familiar.

Fields.MenuText: It looks like fog to me.
Familiar how?
You have a point. I think I've seen that particular shade before...

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't remind you of anything? Any particular Morgana we've tussled with?
I'm reminded of something Asphyxiation used during one of our encounters.
Yeah... It's not natural. I'm almost sure of it.
If that's Morgana mist, we should tell someone. We should sound the alarms or something.
*BOOM*
Sounds like it's too late for that.
*BOOM*
Looks like some of the other Belles have started the fight. We should join them.
Well, we're not going to just stand here and watch.
@BATTLE
That was Asphyxiation! I'm positive, I just know it!
We didn't see any subs in that battle, Nautilus.
You wouldn't. She's really sneaky like that.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't that kinda' like the pot calling the kettle black?
You can't blame everything on one Morgana. There are plenty of them out there.
I suppose it could've been her...

Fields.DialogueText: So, I can be sneaky too, but I'm the good kind of sneaky. She's the evil kind.
Yeah, I know, I know. I just... I really think Asphyxiation was here. She's got it out for me.
So, you think so too! See, we've gotta' go after her!
Did you hear anything during the battle? Did she speak to you?
No, but she wouldn't have. She would've known that I'd go after her as soon as I heard her.
I'm still not certain.
Do you trust me, Captain?
Of course I do. Let's go after whatever tried to ambush us.
Golly gee, you know just what to say to make a girl smile, Captain.
@BATTLE
Nautilus, what are you doing up here? We have to get moving soon.
I'm just saying goodbye to the sky. We're going to be spending a lot of time deep underwater looking for Asphyxiation. I'm going to miss the sun and moon.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I'm going to miss the sky too, but you don't see me whining about it.
We'll still have to come up every once in a while. We're not staying down there for good.
We could always stay on the surface, if you'd prefer.

Fields.DialogueText: You're so mean sometimes, Captain. I'm not whining.
Those times will be few and far between. As soon as I find a trace of Asphyxiation, I'm going to be following that trail until either we find her, or we're out of air.
Then we'd never find her! She prefers the depths. She's all evil that way.
The sky will still be here when we get back.
I know, I just want to soak in as much as I can. I have a feeling it'll take us a little while to find her.
Probably. She's slippery like that.
But, if anyone is going to find her, I want it to be me.
Well, we're not going to find anyone up here.
Actually... We've got a handful of Morganas approaching. So we're going to find someone.
Just not the Morgana we're hunting for. Guess we better get ready for battle.
@BATTLE
*BOOM*
Morganas? They sensed us this deep underwater?
Yeah, that might've been my fault.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean?
Oh, I seriously doubt that. Don't be so hard on yourself.
Of course it's your fault...

Fields.DialogueText: I may, or may not, have accidentally gotten spotted outside the ship.
No... I'm, pretty sure it's my fault. I got spotted.
Hey, don't roll your eyes like that. It was an accident!
I was taking a little swim through some kelp nearby, trying to relax a little, and that's when I realized I wasn't alone. A Morgana sub spotted me.
Well, next time, try and find a less dangerous way to relax, okay?
*BOOM*
Yeah, I think I can handle that.
@BATTLE
Now let's handle these Morganas first...
All right, let's finish this restock ASAP! We need to get back to looking for Asphyxiation.
Nautilus, we haven't found any trace of her yet.
So? We already knew she was a sneaky one.

Fields.MenuText: What if we're looking in the wrong place?
What if she's too sneaky?
I don't think it was Asphyxiation.

Fields.DialogueText: You mean so deep underwater? Asphyxiation wouldn't be anywhere else.
Applesauce, you have a point... We're going to need more magnifying glasses to find this sneaky snake.
If not her, then who, Captain? I'm open to suggestions.
I think it might be a good idea to ask around while we're in port - see if there are any rumors of which we've been unaware.
I guess someone might have some idea of where Asphyxiation's been hiding.
It's better than searching the ocean floor randomly.
I guess we really weren't finding any leads, huh? Sorry, Captain...
Let's just keep our eyes and ears open and see what we can find out.
Found something!
@BATTLE
Golly, this group of Morganas is being stubborn!
@BATTLE
Nautilus, I might've gotten a lead.
A lead? That's fantastic! I was starting to get worried.
Apparently, a Morgana has been roaming these seas for some time. It's gained a reputation for spewing noxious gas across the battlefield as its pack surrounds their prey.
Hmmm, I suppose that could be Asphyxiation... It doesn't really sound like her style, though.

Fields.MenuText: It's the best, and only, lead we have.
I don't think it's her, but I do think it's the Morgana that attacked us at the games.
Maybe that's why she's doing it. We wouldn't expect it.

Fields.DialogueText: That is a good point...
I still believe they're one in the same...
She is tricky like that...
We should check it out... This lead. Do we have a destination?
The Morgana was last sighted heading north. So, I figure if we hurry, we can catch up with her.
Then let's hurry!
Hey, Nautilus, I was hoping to...
Eek, Captain, what is it?!
Uh... I wanted to talk to you about tactics, but now I'm curious about what you're hiding behind your back.
Nothing! I have nothing behind my back. Golly, quit with the third degree, Captain, gosh!
Hmmmm...

Fields.MenuText: Is that a French - English dictionary on your bed?
Are you hiding a present for me behind your back?
Did you steal something? What's going on here?

Fields.DialogueText: Uh... No! That's... That's just a normal everyday dictionary.
Uh... Yes. Yes, that's why I can't show you. Exactly.
I'd never steal something, Captain! How dare you even suggest something like that!? I'm going to have to ask you to leave. Now!
Okay, the fun is wearing off. Just show it to me.
I... Okay, fine. It's embarrassing, but here.
You were writing on your arms? They're covered in text. Is that French?
It's a bunch of different languages. It's a cheat sheet. I didn't want to forget again.
Is this really the best time to be doing that?
This way, I can practice no matter where I am!
*ALARM*
Well, I'd suggest you find some long sleeves, it sounds like we've got a battle in store for us.
Oh, phooey, I'll be fine, Captain. I don't care if the crew sees, I'm not embarrassed.
Then why were you hiding it from me?
Well, it's embarrassing if you see! You're my captain!
@BATTLE
Are we moving more slowly than usual?
It's the water. I think it's thicker than usual. I'm going to go check it out.

Fields.MenuText: Be careful, Nautilus.
Yeah, that seems like a smart idea.
Funny, I was just about to order you to do that.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Captain. I will.
Well, golly, yeah. I have a lot of those.
No order necessary. I'm already on my way.
I'll be back in a quick sec. See ya soon.
If those rumors are right, we're probably being...
Holy honeycombs! That is... Blech, I can hardly breathe. It's not good out there.
Noxious, huh? We must be getting close.
*ALARM*
Based on what I'm hearing, I think we're surrounded, Captain.
That's what I was afraid of.
Asphyxiation is probably watching from somewhere nearby. She must be enjoying this.
Let's focus on the battle at hand. Then we can chase down the source of all these poisonous fumes.
@BATTLE
There! That ship has to be the source of all this noxious fog!
What are you talking about? That Morgana looks nothing like Asphyxiation.
Nautilus, the fog is literally rolling out from the ship. It's clearly creating it.
Oh, I see! Asphyxiation must be on that ship!

Fields.MenuText: Uh, sure, yeah, let's go with that.
So, it's like a Morgana piggy back ride?
Don't be stupid, Nautilus!

Fields.DialogueText: Very sneaky, Asphyxiation. Hiding inside another Morgana.
Hahaha, that's a nice way to put it, Captain. I like it.
I'm not being stupid! Asphyxiation could totally fit in that thing's hull! Right?
*BOOM*
Looks like it finally noticed us. Whether or not she's in there, looks like we're taking that ship down.
I've got a good feeling about this. She'll be in there. I can't wait to see her face as I beat her sneaky little behind.
Let's focus on the fight at hand, Nautilus.
Oh, right! Sorry, sorry.
@BATTLE
I think we've been looking long enough, Nautilus. Asphyxiation was never here.
How can that be? I was sure it was her!
Well, the fog Delusion used was definitely the same stuff that we saw at the games. You can't always be right.
Well, you were right. You always doubted it was Asphyxiation.

Fields.MenuText: No way, I thought it was her!
I wasn't sure, but I mean technically, we aren't sure about anything.
Yeah, but I doubt everything.

Fields.DialogueText: Really? It could've been her, right?!
Oh, you're just trying to make me feel better.
Everything? Maybe I should start doubting more. I don't like being wrong.
Hey, I have a great idea. How about we celebrate!? We did just complete our mission.
Celebrate... What do you have in mind?
Party in the mess hall?
Ohhh, we've gotta have cake, and hats, and games, and... Ooooh, I'll bring the champagne!
Sounds like we'd better make port. We've got some supplies to pick up.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
First things first, Cap!
Cheers, everyone!
Cheers!
I guess everyone needed a little time off, huh?
Everyone loves a party! Drink up, Captain!
Is this champagne?
It's a celebration, isn't it? All good celebrations need a little bubbly. Now, drink!

Fields.MenuText: No, thank you. Someone has to keep their wits about them on this sub.
I guess one glass couldn't hurt.
Don't mind if I do. I love this stuff!

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, phooey on you! You're a fun-stopper, Captain.
That's the spirit! Bottoms up!
Not as much as I do! It's so fizzy and wonderful!
How many glasses have you had, Nautilus?
Glasses? I don't wear glasses. I have perfect vision.
I guess that answers that question.
Although, things are starting to look a little fuzzy. Maybe I do need glasses!
*ALARM*
Woo, woo, woo, what's that? Did someone put on music?
That's not music, Nautilus. That's the alarm. We've got Morganas incoming.
Well, that's silly. Who would set off an alarm in the middle of a party? Bad Morganas!
Let's hope not everyone is as drunk as you are.
Drunk? Bubbly doesn't get you drunk.
I'm... I'm not even going to respond to that one.
@BATTLE
Hey, Captain, you got a second?
Sure, come in. What's going on?
I just wanted to apologize really quickly about that party before. I might've gotten the crew a little too worked up.

Fields.MenuText: No, it's okay. It was a party. What's a party without copious amounts of drinking?
At least we were still able to drunkenly hold off the Morganas.
Yeah, maybe next time we should double up on the cake instead of the drinks.

Fields.DialogueText: That was my frame of mind. Until the Morganas showed up, of course.
Drunkenly? Bubbly doesn't make you drunk.
I do like cake. It's not as fun as bubbly, though.
Anyway, I just wanted to thank you for everything you've done. Even if it wasn't Asphyxiation who attacked us, you still went after her with me.
It meant a lot that you'd trust me like that.
Of course I trust you, Nautilus. I hope you trust me too.
More than anyone, Captain. Which is why I brought this.
More champagne?
Not just any champagne. This is the good stuff. The expensive stuff. I wanted to toast to our friendship.
Well, pour me a glass then. But only ONE glass.
Smart thinking, we should save the rest for later.
Yeah, that why...
Cheers, to our friendship, Captain!
Cheers to trust.
*ALARM*
Cheers to horrible timing.
You good to fight?
Of course I am. I've just gotta stow this bad boy away. We've still got plenty of fancy pants champagne to drink.
@BATTLE
Uh... Sure it doesn't.
Exactly!
Nautilus, you have a package over here. It's pretty weighty for such a small box.
Oooh, gimme it! I wanna see what's inside!
Whoa, calm down. No need to snatch it out of my hands. I would've just handed it to you.
Sorry, I'm just so excited. Oh, see, this must be something about the All Belle Games. Oooh, a letter.
What's it say?
"We're sorry you missed the last event, as well as the ceremony. You would've loved it. Lots of champagne." They know me so well.
Sounds like it.
Oh, oh! The package has the medals I won!

Fields.MenuText: You won medals? I totally forgot about that.
A bronze and a gold, right? Whip 'em out, I wanna see.
About time, I was wondering if I'd ever see them.

Fields.DialogueText: How could you forget? I worked really hard for these, Captain.
I'm trying, I'm trying. There's a lot of packing material in here.
Why do you care so much? They're my medals. I was patient.
Holy... The gold one is so much bigger than the bronze one!
Does that really surprise you? It makes sense to me.
Hmmm... You know what... Here, I want you to have this.
Your bronze medal? Why? I mean, you earned this.
You earned it too. Don't argue, just wear it. We'll be medal buddies!
All right, how do I look?
You pull off bronze better than I do.
I'm not sure if that's really a compliment.
*ALARM*
Oh, wonderful. More Morganas. Let's show them what The Medal Buddies can do!
I really hope that name doesn't stick...
